playn.core
Interface Image

All Known Subinterfaces:
CanvasImage, Image.Region
All Known Implementing Classes:
ImageGL, ImageRegionGL
public interface Image

An image.

Method Detail

width

float width()
This image's width in pixels.

height

float height()
This image's height in pixels.

isReady

boolean isReady()
Whether or not this image is ready to be used.

addCallback

void addCallback(ResourceCallback<? super Image> callback)
Adds a callback to be notified when this image has loaded. If the image is already loaded, the callback will be notified immediately. The callback is discarded once the image is loaded.

subImage

Image.Region subImage(float x,
                      float y,
                      float width,
                      float height)
Returns an image that draws the specified sub-region of this image.

Parameters:
x - the x offset (in pixels) of the subimage.
y - the y offset (in pixels) of the subimage.
width - the width (in pixels) of the subimage.
height - the height (in pixels) of the subimage.

toPattern

Pattern toPattern()
Creates a Pattern that can be used to use this image as a fill in a canvas.

getRgb

void getRgb(int startX,
            int startY,
            int width,
            int height,
            int[] rgbArray,
            int offset,
            int scanSize)
Extracts pixel data from a rectangular area of this image. This method may perform poorly, in particular on HTML and Flash platforms - avoid using this if possible. The returned pixel format is (alpha << 24 | red << 16 | green << 8 | blue), where alpha, red, green and blue are the corresponding channel values, ranging from 0 to 255 inclusive. Currently not implemented for iOS.

Parameters:
startX - x-coordinate of the upper left corner of the area.
startY - y-coordinate of the upper left corner of the area.
width - width of the area.
height - height of the area.
rgbArray - will be filled with the pixel data from the area
offset - fill start offset in rgbArray.
scanSize - number of pixels in a row in rgbArray.

transform

Image transform(Image.BitmapTransformer xform)
Generates a new image from this image's bitmap, using a bitmap transformer created for the platform in use. See JavaBitmapTransformer and IOSBitmapTransformer. This does not work on sub-images.
